intro: Leioluma, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, silver-green leaves that provide a striking visual contrast. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits. The botanical features of Leioluma make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical gardens.
